data.title: 键入缺少的字母，完成下面的文字
data.blankContent: They are typically marked in English by words like each, every and any. The ____ examples ____ applied ____ groups ____ two, and ____ words ____ either ____ or- '' Would ____ like ____ or ____? ``. Since distributive constructions apply an idea relevant to each individual in the group, rather than to the group as a whole, they are most often conceived of as singular, and a singular pronoun is used.
data.partBlankContent: They are typically marked in English by words like each, every and any. The simp____ examples a__ applied t_ groups o_ two, and u__ words li__ either a__ or- '' Would y__ like t__ or cof___? ``. Since distributive constructions apply an idea relevant to each individual in the group, rather than to the group as a whole, they are most often conceived of as singular, and a singular pronoun is used.
data.fullContent: They are typically marked in English by words like each, every and any. The simplest examples are applied to groups of two, and use words like either and or- '' Would you like tea or coffee? ``. Since distributive constructions apply an idea relevant to each individual in the group, rather than to the group as a whole, they are most often conceived of as singular, and a singular pronoun is used.
data.answer: 它们在英语中通常用像each, every和any这样的词来标记。最简单的例子是把两个人分成一组，使用像either 和 or这样的词——“你要茶还是咖啡?”' '。由于分配结构适用于群体中的每个个体，而不是群体作为一个整体，它们通常被认为是单数，并且使用单数代词。
